meanings.def: involving two or more people together
examples: a joint account (= a bank account in the name of more than one person, for example shared by a couple)
The report was a joint effort (= we worked on it together).
They finished in joint first place.
They were joint owners of the house (= they owned it together).
The scheme is a joint Anglo-French operation.
The two sides agreed to establish a joint working group.
They divorced two years ago, but they have joint custody of the children.

meanings.def: a place where two bones are joined together in the body in a way that enables them to bend and move
examples: inflammation of the knee joint
My joints are really stiff this morning.
He dislocated his elbow joint.
He slowly stood up, joints creaking in protest.
He's going to have his hip joint replaced.
You have fluid in the joint.

meanings.def: a place where two or more parts of an object are joined together, especially to form a corner
examples: a joint between two lengths of copper
The joint was sealed with waterproof tape.
To get a strong joint, the groove must be completely filled with glue.
a joint of beef
the Sunday joint (= one traditionally eaten on a Sunday)

meanings.def: a place where people meet to eat, drink, dance, etc., especially one that is cheap
examples: a fast-food joint
The joint was jumping (= full of people and activity).

meanings.def: a cigarette containing marijuana (= an illegal drug)
to look carefully around a building so that you can plan how to steal things from it at a later time
pushed out of its correct position
examples: She put her hip out of joint in the accident.

meanings.def: not working or behaving in the normal way
examples: Time is thrown completely out of joint in the opening chapters.

meanings.def: to upset or annoy somebody, especially by not giving them enough attention
